Description.val: The MK-41 Vertical Launching System (VLS) is a surface combatant missile launching system, designed to store, select and launch various STANDARD Missile configurations, TOMAHAWK, Tactical TOMAHAWK, EVOLVED SEASPARROW (ESSM) and Vertical Launch ASROC (VLA) missiles.  The MK-41 VLS significantly improves missile capacity, flexibility, multi-mission capability, reaction time and rate of fire and is designed to be adaptable to present and future weapon systems.  Current configurations are: two 61 cell launchers, forward and aft, for 22 TICONDEROGA (CG 47) Class Cruisers beginning with CG-52; one 61 cell aft and one 29 cell launcher forward for 28 ARLEIGH BURKE (DDG 51) Class Destroyers; and one 64 cell launcher aft and one 32 cell launcher forward for 34 DDG 51 FLT IIA ships.

Justification.val: Funding for the Vertical Launch Systems program has been moved to Other Procurement, Navy (OPN) line item 5231, Ship Missile Support Equipment, beginning in FY 2015.

ImplementationMethodName.val: AIT INSTALLATION:: Installation Name: MTCP EQUIVALENT OF 4293

Description.val: Vertical Launch Systems (VLS) Upgrades have been cancelled on SSNs in FY14-17.

ImplementationMethodName.val: AIT INSTALLATION:: Installation Name: 4292 FAIRING BLOCK RECURRING

Description.val: This alteration modifies the VLS fairing to Muzzle Hatch connecting links, fairing lock bar cylinder and lock bar components with predominantly off-shelf hardware to provide increased accuracy of adjustment and eliminate potential binding and interference areas.

ImplementationMethodName.val: [none specified]:: Installation Name: SHIPALT MATERIAL HALL SWITCH

Description.val: This alteration replaces internal glass-body electromechanical reed switches with an electronic Hall Effect switch actuated by a single pole magnetic field to provide ease of manufacture, eliminate magnet rotational positioning of present magnets, and allow use of higher reliability magnets better suited to the environment.
